Prepare for Ramadan – part 11

If you don’t want these emails, don’t report them as spam, click here and unsubscribe from "Islamic Reminders".

Assalamu Alaykum Oguzhan, may Allah give you good health and a long life!

Before delving into today’s topic, please support our Dawah and Masjid project if you have the means.

The Prophet ﷺ said:

“Charity does not in any way decrease the wealth.” [Sahih Muslim 2588]
> I Want to Donate Monthly & in sha Allah Attain The Highest Level of Jannah <
> I Want to Make a One-Time Donation <
Oguzhan I hope this series on how to prepare for Ramadan has benefitted you and helped you to get you ready for this blessed month.

The last piece of advice I want to share with you is very vital.

If you stick by it you will succeed in this world and in the next in shaa Allah.

My advice is: Make this Ramadan a new beginning not another end!

Allah the Most High give us ample opportunities and chances in our lives for a fresh start and a new beginning.

Ramadan is definitely one such opportunity, and perhaps even the best of them.

Many Ramadans have we witnessed and lived, many chances and opportunities we have had in the past, but failed to grab.

Ramadan is here again, as if it’s telling us: make this your moment of determination, it’s time for you to turn to Allah and to His Mercy and Forgiveness.

Hasn’t Allah the Most High said: “And hasten towards forgiveness from your Lord and a Paradise as vast as the heavens and the earth, prepared for those mindful (of Allah).” (Quran, 3:133)

The Month of Ramadan is full of opportunities to start a clean and pure journey to Allah, to His paradise and mercy.

So don’t let this opportunity go without you making this resolution to make it a new beginning.

A new beginning where you will continue to worship Allah and come Him nearer til the day you return to Him.

I ask Allah to let me and you be among those who will make this resolution and abide by it. May Allah bless your Ramadan and make it a mean to attain His Pleasure and Forgiveness. Amin

Oguzhan our Islam Net team will be sending you a daily email with valuable tips and reminders and I will also share daily some reflections on some verses from the Quran.

So don’t miss these emails that will increase your iman and make this Ramadan a changing point in your life in shaa Allah.

RAMADAN MUBARAK!
LATEST MASJID UPDATE, 14-03-23!
Alhamdulillah, we have started the first stage of refurbishing the Masjid Property we’ve purchased.

You have donated generously since the beginning, may Allah accept from you, but we still need your help to reconstruct the building we've purchased into the greatest multipurpose Masjid and community center in Norway, in sha Allah!

Would you like to help and share in the rewards?

The Prophet ﷺ said:

“Whoever builds a Masjid for Allah, Allah will build for him a similar house in Jannah.”
[Muslim 1085]
> I Want to Donate Monthly & in sha Allah Attain The Highest Level of Jannah <
> I Want to Make a One-Time Donation <
The Prophet ﷺ said:

“Charity does not in any way decrease the wealth.” [Sahih Muslim 2588]

When one desires to give in charity, Shyatan would whisper:

“If you give charity, your wealth will diminish. You have one hundred dollars, if you spend ten out of it you will have ninety left, and your wealth will be reduced. So don’t give Sadaqah.”

However, the one who does not speak of his own desires has said:

“Charity does not in any way decrease the wealth.”

How is that?

Although the wealth may be reduced in quantity at the moment you give it, it will soon increase in its worth and blessings.

Thus, these ten dollars can transform to a hundred dollars as Allah has said (translation of its meaning):

“… And whatsoever you spend of anything (in Allah’s Cause). He will replace it. For He is the Best Provider.” (Quran 34:39)

Allah will not only make a compensation for you in this Duniya, but He will give you a huge reward in the Akhirah!

What is that huge reward?
  • Your Sadaqah will be multiplied up to 700 times!
  • Allah will enlarge it to the size of a mountain!
  • You will be shaded by it on the Day of Resurrection!
  • You will receive the Ajr for all the good deeds that have been born from it!
  • You will be honored as the neighbor of Allah because of it!
  • Allah will build a house for you in Jannah where you will reside in forever!
Would you not want that for your afterlife?
> I Want to Donate Monthly & in sha Allah Attain The Highest Level of Jannah <
> I Want to Make a One-Time Donation <
NB! I understand if you can’t donate daily, but please follow my emails to keep updated, make Du’a and donate whenever you can.

JazakAllah Khayr Oguzhan!

Wassalam
Muhammed Z. Alburundy, Islam Net

Assalamu Alaykum Oguzhan, may Allah give you good health and a long life!

Before delving into today’s topic, please support our Dawah and Masjid project if you have the means.

The Prophet ﷺ said:

“Save yourself from Hellfire even by giving half a date-fruit in charity.”
[Sahih al-Bukhari 1417]
> I Want to Donate Monthly & in sha Allah Attain The Highest Level of Jannah <
> I Want to Make a One-Time Donation <
Have you been through some hard times? Yes I suppose for everyone has. Some more than others, but we all are being TESTED in this life.

This is the nature of the worldly life, as Allah said in His Glorious Book:

“Every soul will taste death. And We test you with evil and with good as a trial, and to Us, you will be returned.” (Quran 21:35)

Often in hard times, many lose hope and fall into despair. For some, it can be so bad that they lose their IMAN altogether.

But I will show you a fantastic solution that our beloved Prophet (ﷺ) thought us.

If you practice this blessed advice from him (ﷺ), Allah will answer you in difficult times.

And who does not want such a privilege?

Imagine having Allah on your side when life gets really difficult.

No doubt, this will ease the hardships and prevent you from losing hope and falling into despair.

In a beautiful hadith collected by al-Tirmidhi (3382), the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

“Whoever wishes that Allah responds to him during hardship and grief, then let him supplicate a lot when at ease.”

ALLAHU AKBAR! What a beautiful hadith! In it, you have the solution that will save you when you go through hard times.

The solution is that you remember Allah in times of ease by making dua to Him.

Why is this so crucial? Because in times of ease, most of us forget to make dua to Allah. When everything is fine, we often feel that we don’t need anything.

And this is wrong since we are always in dire need of Allah’s MERCY.

So, by remembering Allah in good times, you will be loved by Allah, and He will remember you and respond to you when you call Him in hard times.

Start from today and always make dua, and you will be among those Allah responds to.

I hope you benefitted from this quick reminder Oguzhan. Stay tuned for more in shaa Allah!

The Prophet ﷺ said:

“Save yourself from Hellfire even by giving half a date-fruit in charity.”
[Sahih al-Bukhari 1417]

SubhanAllah, that is such a profound statement!

In most cases, a half date-fruit is insignificant to both the giver and the receiver. But the Hadith demonstrates how huge the concept of giving Sadaqah is in the sight of Allah. And it shows that the immense reward of Sadaqah is not limited only to the wealthy among us.

You don’t have to donate a million dollars or many thousand.

You can donate whatever little that is in your capacity, and that – because of your Ikhlas and Niyyah – can be enough to save you from the fire of Hell.

Even if a small donation by itself won’t make that big of a difference to the recipient, when we come together and give in the way of Allah, put together that will make a huge impact!

Brothers and sisters, we need your support NOW, and you need the reward!

So please don’t delay giving in Sadaqah, even if it’s a small amount. Because this small donation of $50 or $25 can save you from the Hellfire and open the gates for you to enter Jannah, your eternal home in sha Allah…

And if you’re able to give a big donation, then know that Allah is more generous than you can ever imagine! The more you give to Him, far more will He repay you both in this Duniya and in the Akhirah!

“… And to Allah belong the treasures of the heavens and the earth...”
[Quran 63:7]

Maar niet getreurd!

Beste Oguzhan,

De STAP-ronde zit er weer op!

De subsidiepot was binnen de kortste tijd op. De drukte was dan ook enorm... Is het jou gelukt om het STAP-budget aan te vragen?

Is het jou niet gelukt?
Start alsnog extra voordelig met jouw thuisstudie

We begrijpen maar al te goed dat het heel frustrerend is om (meermaals) naast de subsidie te grijpen. 

Wij vinden dat niets jouw ontwikkeling in de weg mag staan. Én om te zorgen dat jij alsnog van start kan gaan met jouw thuisstudie hebben wij een exclusieve kortingsactie voor jou!

Ontvang de komende 7 dagen 25% korting op het lesgeld!

Gebruik de kortingscode: STAP-voordeel

✚	Gratis noise cancelling headphone of tablet met toetsenbord
✚	15 dagen vrijblijvend proberen
✚	Niet geslaagd, lesgeld terug garantie

Upgrade je CV, ontwikkel een vaardigheid of ga voor een compleet nieuwe carrière: kies een thuisstudie die bij je past en voeg jezelf bij de tienduizenden studenten die zich jaarlijks ontplooien met een NHA-studie.

Vind jouw cursus of opleiding	>
* De kortingscode is alleen geldig i.c.m. het e-mailadres dat op jouw STAP-aanmeldbewijs vermeldt staat.

8 voordelen van studeren bij NHA

1)     Studeer met 25% korting op het lesgeld
Kies uit meer dan 650 cursussen en opleidingen. Van branche-erkende opleidingen tot handige, korte cursussen.

2)      Ontvang een gratis welkomstcadeau én één jaar lang gratis toegang tot E-books (stopt automatisch)
Kies tijdens jouw inschrijving voor een gratis tablet met toetsenbord of een noise cancelling headphone. Ideaal voor tijdens het studeren. Daarnaast ontvang je één jaar toegang tot de E-book bibliotheek van NHA met ruim 100 E-books en 40 audio-books.

3)     Probeer het 15 dagen vrijblijvend uit
Onzeker over jouw keuze? Gewoon starten, je ontvangt jouw cursus of opleiding de eerste 15 dagen vrijblijvend op proef.

4)     Spreid eenvoudig je kosten
Betaal jouw opleiding eenvoudig in kleine maandbedragen. De examens boek je pas nadat je de betreffende module hebt afgerond. 

5)     Studeer in je eigen tempo, waar en wanneer je wilt
Studeer in je eigen tempo, met tot 3 jaar studiebegeleiding. Naast je baan, jouw gezin, sport en hobby’s. 
 
6)     Ontvang persoonlijke begeleiding van deskundige vakdocenten
Stel vragen en laat je huiswerk nakijken door jouw docent. Leg daarnaast contact met je mede-cursisten in de digitale leeromgeving.

7)     Studeer met erkende kwaliteit
Als cursist van NHA profiteer je van 85 jaar ervaring in thuis studeren. Maar dat niet alleen, je geniet bij elke cursus of opleiding ook van dezelfde erkende kwaliteit.

8)     Toch niet geslaagd? Lesgeld terug garantie!

Hopelijk zien we jou binnenkort terug in onze online leeromgeving.

Tot snel!

Met vriendelijke groet,

Sophie

Oguzhan In a few hours, if Allah wills, Allah will grant you a tremendous gift …

The gift of Ramadan. Have you really reflected on how great this gift is?

Many of us have fasted Ramadan year after year.

Maybe you have lived through 5 or 10, or 20 Ramadans.

How have you handled this gift Allah gave you so many times?

A gift that some people will not receive this year since Allah decreed their demise before this year’s Ramadan.

May Allah have mercy on them. Amin

And now another Ramadan will come upon us; will we take it also for granted?

Did you know that even 1 Ramadan can make a huge impact and difference?

Consider this incident that happened in the time of the Prophet (ﷺ).

Talhah bin Ubaidullah (RA) narrated that two men from the tribe of Bali came to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). They had become Muslim together, but one of them used to strive harder than the other.

The one who to strive harder went out to fight and was martyred. The other one stayed for a year longer, then he passed away.

One night Talhah had a dream about them and said:

“ I saw in a dream that I was at the gate of Paradise, and I saw them (those two men). Someone came out of Paradise and admitted the one who died last, then he came out and admitted the one who had been martyred. Then he came back to me and said: ‘Go back, for your time has not yet come’.”

The next morning, Talhah told the people of that, and they were amazed.

News of that reached the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), and they told him the story. He asked them: “Why are you amazed at that?”

They said: “O Messenger of Allah, the first one was the one who strove harder, then he was martyred, but the other one was admitted to Paradise before him.

The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Did he not stay behind for a year?”

They said: “Yes”.

He (ﷺ) said: “And did not Ramadan come and he fasted, and he offered such and such prayers during that year.”

They said: “Yes.”

The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “The difference between them is greater than the difference between heaven and earth.” (Sunan Ibn Majah 3925)

What a powerful story?

The greatest lesson we can take from it is how much even one Ramadan you fast can mean.

Even one Ramadan can produce such a huge reward that will differentiate you from those who didn’t fast that Ramadan.

So let’s seriously thank Allah for this great gift and do our best this upcoming Ramadan.

May Allah give us all the ability to do that. Amin

Ramadan Mubarak!

I hope you benefitted from this quick reminder Oguzhan. Stay tuned for more beneficial reminders this Ramadan to help you do your best!

We should compete in doing good like Abu Bakr RA!

Abu Huraira reported that Allah’s Messenger ﷺ said: Who amongst you is fasting today?

Abu Bakr said: I am.

The Prophet ﷺ said: Who amongst you followed a funeral procession today?

Abu Bakr said: I did.

The Prophet ﷺ said: Who amongst you served food to the needy?

Abu Bakr said: I did.

The Prophet ﷺ said: Who amongst you has today visited the sick?

Abu Bakr said: I did.

Thereupon Allah’s Messenger ﷺ said: Anyone in whom (these good deeds) are combined will certainly enter Paradise.

[Muslim 1028 b]

Can you do as many good deeds as Abu Bakr in one single day?

Imagine the reward you can in sha Allah gain by giving $100 to establish our Masjid:

These four deeds are the exact deeds that Abu Bakr did that day, and the Prophet ﷺ said that the one who does them will certainly enter Paradise…

Now imagine you getting the rewards for other people doing these deeds, just because you gave a small sacrifice today!

The Prophet ﷺ said:

“He who calls others to follow the Right Guidance will have a reward equal to the reward of those who follow him…” [Muslim 6470]

Would you not want that for your afterlife?

Assalamu Alaykum Oguzhan! SubhanAllah!
Assalamu Alaykum Wa Rahmatullahi Wa Barakatuh Oguzhan. I hope in sha Allah this email reaches you in the best of health and Iman.

Just as a side note, if you don't want me to email you again, you can unsubscribe at the bottom.

You're one of the amazing people who donated to the Save Iman Masjid project in Norway. I would like to thank you for your amazing support!

Your contribution was really meaningful to us. With the help of your incredible generosity, we moved a step closer to establish our Masjid & Dawah center in Norway. But we're still not there yet ...

I know I have asked you about this in the past, but situations change, and Allah opens up opportunities for whom He wills, when He wills.

So, I was hoping you maybe now would consider becoming one of our special monthly supporters?
>> Yes! I Want to Donate Monthly and Get Great Reward <<
Smart people like yourself are never content when it comes to their Akhirah.

The Prophet ﷺ promised a house in Jannah for building a Masjid, and you donated.

Probably, that didn't make you think "Alhamdulillah Jannah is now secured, so there's no need to continue giving for the sake of Allah."

Because at the end of the day, only Allah knows which actions are accepted, and which are rejected.

As His servants, our purpose is to continuously strive to do good, hoping for His acceptance, and fearing for His displeasure.

SubhanAllah, how beautiful is that? Wallahi, it is an amazing concept!

It makes us believers continuously strive to become better human beings and worshippers of Allah. It brings out the best in us.

Every day is a new opportunity to increase in reward, so what better can you do than becoming a regular supporter of Khayr?

If you become a monthly donor, you will continuously be sharing in the reward for all those who as a result of our Dawah and Masjid project:
  • Convert to Islam.
  • Come closer to Allah.
  • Start to pray and worship Allah.
  • Learn Arabic, the language of the Quran.
  • Learn Dawah and call others to Islam.
  • Study the religion of Allah, memorize the Quran and become Imams and leaders in our community.
>> Yes! I Want to Donate Monthly and Get This Great Reward <<
Our Dawah through our social media platforms is giving our supporters the reward for reaching millions of video views and impressions!

Just the last year our supporters got the reward for organically reaching over 5.5 million video views with the message of Islam through YouTube! And they got the reward for over 10 million organic impressions resulting from our Dawah through Facebook!

Monthly we we have around 400,000 views on YouTube and over 800,000 impressions on Facebook, organically!

From paid marketing we're reaching up to (and sometimes above) 4 million people, 2.5 million video views, and 14 million impressions a month!

In the last years, around 200 Norwegians have found Islam, and uncountable Muslims have come closer to Allah through our Dawah!

Now imagine YOU having the immense reward for this Dawah on your scale of good deeds!
>> Yes! I Want to Donate Monthly and Get This Great Reward <<
> I can't donate monthly, but I can make a one time donation <
JazakAllah Khayr Oguzhan!

Wassalam
Fahad Qureshi, Islam Net

Ramadan Tip 1

Assalamu alaykum Oguzhan! In sha Allah this email reaches you in the best of health and iman! Ramadan Mubarak to you and your family!

This Ramadan we’ll be sending you a daily email with tips on how you can get the maximum out of this blessed month. 

Today is the 1st day of Ramadan, and we hope this will be such a beautiful experience for you and your family, from which you will benefit the utmost in sha Allah! We wanted to remind you about some of the merits of this blessed month, so that you can, with the help of Allah, make the most out of it. That is because when one is reminded of the greatness of something, one will act according to it.

Ramadan is the month of goodness and blessings, the month of bestowment and flourishment, and the month in which the Quran was sent down as a guide to mankind, as clear signs for guidance. It is the month that is known for mercy, forgiveness, and safety from the Fire.

In fact, the Prophet ﷺ said, “When the month of Ramadan starts, the gates of the Heaven are opened, and the gates of Hell are closed, and the devils are chained” [Sahih al-Bukhari 1899].

And indeed the gates of Heaven are opened in this month, for the increase in good actions from mankind is evident. And the gates of Hell are closed for the decrease in disobedience from the people of faith is also clear. And the devils are chained so that they are not able to do what they would normally do otherwise.

Constantly try to remind yourself of the greatness of this month. Realize the great blessing Allah has bestowed upon you by allowing you to live to see another Ramadan. Many of the people who were here with us last Ramadan are not with us anymore and did not get a chance to experience yet another Ramadan.

It is truly a blessing to be able to worship Allah in this great month. We ask Allah to make you and your loved ones amongst those who benefit the most by being able to do the most beloved actions to Allah in this great month. Ameen.

We would also like to remind you about our ongoing dawah projects that you can share in rewards for. Last year our videos on YouTube got 25,7 millions views Alhamdulillah. Imagine the reward of Islam’s message reaching so many people! The Prophet ﷺ used to be the most generous in the month of Ramadan, so it’s a part of the sunnah to give extra sadaqah in this blessed month.

If you have the opportunity, we hope Allah gives you the tawfeeq to start a regular donation to this noble cause in this noble month, and that He rewards you immensely for it. And if you’re already one of our amazing monthly donors, please consider making an extra one-time donation in this blessed month. May Allah preserve you and give you the best in this life and in the hereafter. Ameen.

JazakAllah Khayr Oguzhan!

Wassalam,
